column4: Anyone know of a good text based system monitor for the desktop?
Conky
conky flickers in gnome
Add the following lines to your .conkyrc  "own_window yes"   "own_window_transparent yes" and "own_window_type override"
let me give that a try
and also add "double_buffer"
are you running conky?
yes, right now, in gnome 2.14 with no flicker
cool lets see if I can add those.
You might also need to add "on_bottom yes" to your .conkyrc also.
Conky: failed to set up double buffer
That's not good.
yeah I don't get it
thats definately why i'm getting the flicker
It's probably a problem with your Xorg configuration file.  Run "sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf" and then add this line "Load "dbe"" into the "Section "Module"" section and save and then restart x11.
So near where you have "load glx" and "load dri" and such just add "Load "dbe"" also.
DBE stands for double-buffer extension
ahh gotcha yeah that was missing let me restart gdm brb
okay that worked only thing that didn't wokr is I added it to the session as a startup program it loaded upon loggin in then when the wallpaper came up it disappeared
I think I had problems with it starting too.  Make sure you start it AFTER nautilus starts up.  For me it only really works if i start it manually, otherwise nautilus tries to cover it.
yeah that appears to be what happened.  Do you know much about configuring what information it displays?  is that all in the .conkyrc file?
It's all in the .conkyrc file.  It's rather confusing at first too.
